#Text=WONDERFUL PRESERVATION The prolongation of life under circumstances such as we are now to state , is so much beyond our estimate of the capability of the human frame , that , were we not assured of the accuracy of the following narrative , we should have had some hesitation in giving publicity .
#Text=Of its correctness , however , there is no doubt : -On Tuesday , the 9th inst .

#Text=, Mary Fletcher , daughter of Mr Fletcher , King 's House , Glencoe , having been on a visit to her sister in Rannoch , left the house of one of Mr McLaren of Camuseroch 's shepherds at Cruach , a little after breakfast time , on her way to her father 's house , through the moor of Rannoch , and the shepherd 's servant-maid accompanied her for nearly two miles , till they came in sight of one of the highest pinnacles at the entrance into Glencoe , called Buachail-eit , at the foot of which stands the King's-house , when Mary insisted that the maid should return , as she was sure she would make out the house , now that the Buachail-more was in view .

#Text=They therefore parted , and no apprehension was entertained of Mary having reached her house till the afternoon of Thursday , when the shepherd , whose house she had left , happening to be at the King's-house , remarked to her mother , that he was sure Mary must have been much fatigued by the time she had arrived on Tuesday .

#Text=But Mary had not arrived , nor had her friends heard that she had left her sister 's house ; and , from the tempestuous state of the weather , little doubt remained of her having long ere now paid the debt of nature .

#Text=Her friends , therefore , set out in search of her corpse , but as they were necessarily too few for such a purpose-her own family , it may be said , constituting the whole population of the district , they sent for the people of Rannoch to join them .

#Text=On Wednesday , another of Mr McLaren 's shepherds was surprised at meeting the tracts of a woman 's shoes in different parts of his range , where , even in summer , a woman 's foot had seldom trode , and , on mentioning the matter in his master 's family , neither sage nor gay could account for so singular a phenomenon , till the arrival , on Thursday night , of the intelligence that Mary Fletcher had been lost .
#Text=Early on Friday morning , a numerous party , with the shepherd at their head , proceeded to where the tracts had been seen .

#Text=These they followed in various directions , through ground which , forming part of the three counties of Perth , Argyle , and Inverness , has not its likeness elsewhere in either of these counties , in point of danger .

#Text=It is no exaggeration to say , that where it is not a swamp from which , if once entered , there is no retreating , it is a broken morass , full of pools of stagnant water , bottomless for ought we know , but often so small as to escape the notice of the most wary shepherd .

#Text=At last , after tracing her footsteps , with great difficulty , along the Blackwater , through Cor-our and Leachd-chaorin , and back again along the ridge of the Cruach , the party were nearly on the point of giving up the search as fruitless , when their hopes were once more revived by one of them observing , at a considerable distance , an object which seemed to resemble a human being .
#Text=They therefore made towards it , and at last found Mary , what , without much impropriety of speech , might be called a living corpse .

#Text=She seemed to recognise her friends , for , on coming up to her , a smile would have expressed her joy at her deliverance , but the museles of the face denied their assistance tried to hold out her hand , but it too had forgot its cunning then attempted to speak , but the tongue likewise refused its office there sat poor Mary , breathing indeed the breath of life , but with all the faculties that render life desirable suspended .
#Text=During the last part of her wandering , her strength appears to have entirely failed her , for every here and there , there were marks of her having fallen .
#Text=She had likewise lost one of her shoes , but the foot thus deprived of its protection was carefully wrapped up in a handkerchief .

#Text=Not expecting to find her alive , nothing , if such thing there might be , that would do her good was at hand , save some bread and cheese , and a little of the former being put into her mouth , she no sooner swallowed it than she fainted .
#Text=She revived , however , in a little time , and was carried home to her sorrowful parents , but whose sorrow was now turned into joy , on finding their lost child still in life .

#Text=How a girl , without food , and but indifferently clad , ( for she had nothing on , in addition to her usual dress , but a shawl , ) and exposed alternately to the inclemency of drifting snow , pelting sleet , or life-chilling frost , could have survived for three days and three nights in such ground as we have described , is a mystery that can only be solved by Him who tempers the wind to the shorn lamb .

#Text=Few circumstances could have occurred more calculated to impress upon us the uncertainty of human life than the miraculous escape we have just narrated , as contrasted with the untimely death which we are to record : -A young man of the name of Cumming , who had been for some years a gardener at Kinfauns Castle , having got leave to visit his parents at Killiehonan , in Rannoch , passed through Appin on the 3d of this month , and met with an acquaintance who convoyed him to the top of the hill that separates Appin from Foss , where they parted a little after the dusk of the evening .

#Text=Cumming took the road leading to Rannoch , by the base of Shichaillin , and had travelled about 4 miles , when he was met by a man belonging to Foss , to whom he spoke and enquired if he knew if any person was on before him .
#Text=-He was told that one had passed within a quarter of an hour whom he could probably overtake , and he then walked on smartly apparently in good health and spirits .
#Text=Nothing more was heard of him till last week , when one of his acquaintance from Appin asked of some of his friends in Rannoch how he was , and when they might expect him on his way back ?
#Text=His friends in Rannoch were not aware that he had left Kinfauns .

#Text=Search was made immediately for his body , which was found about thirty yards off the road , either in , or at the side of a small burn that runs into Lochan-doimaig , about a mile and a half beyond where he had been last seen .

#Text=There was no appearance of his having been drowned , nor was the burn large enough to do so , and as the night was calm and clear , and as there was no snow sufficient to offer any obstruction , his death can only be ascribed to some immediate and fatal attack of sickness , although this will not satisfactorily account for his body being so far off the road .

#Text=We are happy to say , however , that there is no suspicion of his having been in any way unfairly dealt with-at least by man ; but unfortunately the place where he died has long been held a principal , and latterly the only remaining abode , in that district , of the agents of the Evil-One ; and that circumstance , together with the fact that this is the fourth person who has lost his life within the recollection of the present generation , at or near the same spot , and all in a manner equally mysterious , will have the effect of strengthening the belief that such a being as Bodach-an-lochain was , and still is , and that there are more things in heaven and in earth than are dreamt of in our philosophy .
#Text=
